title: On Bear Ridge, Royal Court, review: plenty of magnetism from Rhys Ifans, but this very British drama doesn't quite grip
text:
Rhys Ifans is far, very far, from Notting Hill in this beguiling-infuriating drama from Welsh playwright Ed Thomas, set amid a remote depopulated and devastated rural (implicitly Welsh) landscape, and filled with a shiver-making sense of mourning but also a fair bit of shudder-making mumbo-jumbo.

We’re miles away from civilised Richard Curtis-land, then, but fans of Spike – Hugh Grant’s scrawny, beardy, sweetly unsavoury (Welsh) flatmate – will still experience flickers of recognition. Although Ifans has amply proved himself a leading man in his own right, his discernible forte is the gone-to-seed outsider, the transfixing misfit for whom hygiene isn’t always a top priority.
